question: Posted By mrk on September 11, 1998 at 11:58:58:In Reply to: Re: Precursor to diabetes? posted by CCF Neurology - AY on September 10, 1998 at 09:27:06:Is peripheral neuropathy ever a precursor to adult-onset diabetes?Thanks for your question.  One of the complication of Diabetes Mellitusis peripheral neuropathy, frequently starting in the low extremities,manifesting as numbness, tingling, pins&needles in the soles and/orback of feet.  Peripheral neuropathy, however does not cause Diabetes.I hope this information is helpful.This information is provided for general medical education purposes only.Please consult your doctor regarding diagnostic and treatment options.I understand PN is a common complication of diabetes...what I want to know is if PN ever manifests itself BEFORE diabetes. Thanks for your followup answer.
title: Re: Precursor to diabetes?
